intro: Didissandra petiolata, commonly known as the smooth-stemmed didissandra, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, followed by berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
